name: Spaghetti Bolognese
preparations: Cook spaghetti according to package instructions, then drain and set aside.
In a large skillet, brown the ground beef over medium heat until fully cooked. Drain excess fat.
Add diced onion, minced garlic, and grated carrot to the skillet. Sauté until the vegetables are tender.
Stir in crushed tomatoes, tomato paste, dried oregano, salt, and pepper. Simmer for 15-20 minutes.
Serve the Bolognese sauce over cooked spaghetti and sprinkle with grated Parmesan cheese.

name: Chicken Stir-Fry
preparations: In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, oyster sauce, and cornstarch. Set aside.
Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over high heat.
Add chicken slices to the hot skillet and cook until browned and cooked through. Remove from skillet and set aside.
In the same skillet, add bell pepper, onion, garlic, and broccoli. Stir-fry for 3-4 minutes until the vegetables are crisp-tender.
Return the cooked chicken to the skillet and pour the sauce mixture over the ingredients. Stir-fry for an additional 2-3 minutes until the sauce thickens and coats the ingredients.
Serve the chicken stir-fry over steamed rice or noodles.

name: Caprese Salad
preparations: Arrange tomato and mozzarella slices on a platter, alternating between them.
Tuck fresh basil leaves between the tomato and mozzarella slices.
In a small bowl, whisk together balsamic vinegar, olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Drizzle the dressing over the tomato and mozzarella slices.
Let the salad marinate for a few minutes before serving.

name: Beef Tacos
ingredients: Shredded lettuce, diced tomatoes, shredded cheese, and sour cream(for toppings)
preparations: In a skillet, cook ground beef over medium heat until browned. Drain excess fat.
Add diced onion and minced garlic to the skillet and sauté until fragrant.
Stir in chili powder, cumin, paprika, salt, and pepper. Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes.
Warm the tortillas in a separate skillet or microwave.
Fill each tortilla with the cooked beef mixture and top with shredded lettuce, diced tomatoes, shredded cheese, and sour cream.
Fold the tortillas and serve immediately.

name: Vegetable Curry
ingredients: 2 cups mixed vegetables (e.g., carrots, bell peppers, peas, cauliflower)
preparations: Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add diced onion and minced garlic to the skillet. Sauté until the onion is translucent.
Stir in curry powder, cumin, and coriander. Cook for 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
Pour in coconut milk and bring to a simmer.
Add mixed vegetables to the skillet and cook until tender, about 10-15 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve the vegetable curry over cooked rice and garnish with fresh cilantro.

name: Caesar Salad
ingredients: 1 head romaine lettuce, torn into bite-sized pieces
preparations: In a large bowl, combine torn romaine lettuce, grated Parmesan cheese, and croutons.
Drizzle Caesar dressing over the salad and toss to coat the ingredients evenly.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
If desired, add grilled chicken breast slices to the salad.
Serve the Caesar salad as a side dish or main course.

name: Margherita Pizza
preparations: Preheat the oven to the temperature specified on the pizza dough package.
Roll out the pizza dough on a floured surface to your desired thickness.
Place the rolled-out dough on a baking sheet or pizza stone.
Spread tomato sauce evenly over the dough, leaving a border around the edges.
Arrange mozzarella slices on top of the sauce.
Tear fresh basil leaves and sprinkle them over the pizza.
Drizzle olive oil over the pizza and season with salt and pepper.
Bake in the preheated oven according to the pizza dough package instructions, typically 10-15 minutes or until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is bubbly.
Remove from the oven and let the pizza cool for a few minutes before slicing and serving.

name: Chocolate Chip Cookies
preparations: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a large mixing bowl, cream together softened butter, granulated sugar, and brown sugar until light and fluffy.
Beat in the eggs one at a time, then add vanilla extract.
In a separate bowl, whisk together flour, baking soda, and salt. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the butter mixture and mix until just combined.
Stir in chocolate chips.
Drop rounded tablespoons of cookie dough onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Bake for 9-11 minutes or until golden brown around the edges.
Remove from the oven and let the cookies cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

name: Omelette
ingredients: Fillings of your choice (e.g., cheese, vegetables, ham)
preparations: In a bowl, whisk together eggs, milk, salt, and pepper until well combined.
Heat butter in a non-stick skillet over medium heat until melted.
Pour the egg mixture into the skillet and let it cook undisturbed for a minute.
Using a spatula, gently lift the edges of the omelette and tilt the skillet to allow the uncooked eggs to flow to the edges.
Once the omelette is mostly set but still slightly runny on top, add your choice of fillings to one side.
Fold the other side of the omelette over the fillings and cook for another minute until the cheese is melted (if using).
Slide the omelette onto a plate and serve hot.

name: Berry Smoothie
ingredients: 1 cup mixed berries (e.g., strawberries, blueberries, raspberries)
preparations: Place mixed berries, ripe banana, milk, plain yogurt, and sweetener (if using) in a blender.
Blend on high speed until smooth and creamy.
Taste and adjust the sweetness if necessary by adding more honey or maple syrup.
Pour the smoothie into glasses and serve immediately.

name: Chicken Biryani
ingredients: Whole spices (cinnamon stick, cardamom pods, cloves)
preparations: Rinse the rice and soak it in water for 30 minutes. Drain and set aside.
In a large pan, heat ghee or oil and sauté the whole spices for a minute.
Add onions and cook until golden brown. Then add ginger-garlic paste and cook for another minute.
Add chicken pieces and cook until they are browned.
Stir in tomatoes, biryani masala, and yogurt. Cook for 2-3 minutes.
Add the soaked rice and mix well. Pour water (1:2 ratio of rice to water), season with salt, and bring to a boil.
Reduce the heat, cover the pan, and let it simmer for about 20-25 minutes until the rice and chicken are cooked.
Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot.

name: Paneer Tikka Masala
preparations: Heat butter in a pan and sauté onions until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for a minute.
Stir in the tomato puree and cook for a few minutes until the oil separates.
Add tikka masala powder and salt. Mix well.
Add the diced capsicum and cook for 2-3 minutes.
Add the paneer cubes and gently stir to coat them with the masala.
Pour in the heavy cream and simmer for a few minutes until the flavors blend.
Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve with naan or rice.

name: Masoor Dal (Red Lentil Curry)
preparations: Wash the lentils thoroughly and cook them in a pressure cooker with enough water until soft.
Heat ghee or oil in a pan and add cumin seeds. Let them splutter.
Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.
Stir in the green chilies, tomatoes, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Cook until the tomatoes are soft and well-cooked.
Add the cooked lentils to the pan and mix well.
Simmer for a few minutes, stirring occasionally.
Sprinkle garam masala and garnish with fresh coriander leaves before serving.

name: Aloo Gobi (Potato and Cauliflower Curry)
preparations: Heat oil in a pan and add cumin seeds. Let them splutter.
Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.
Stir in the tomatoes, turmeric powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, and salt. Cook until the tomatoes are soft and well-cooked.
Add the cauliflower florets and potatoes to the pan. Mix well to coat them with the masala.
Cover the pan and cook on low heat until the vegetables are tender.
Sprinkle garam masala and garnish with fresh coriander leaves before serving.

name: Gulab Jamun
ingredients: Sugar syrup (made with 1 cup sugar and 1 cup water)
preparations: In a mixing bowl, combine milk powder, all-purpose flour, baking soda, ghee or melted butter, cardamom powder, and saffron strands.
Gradually add milk and mix to form a soft dough.
Divide the dough into small equal-sized balls and roll them gently.
Heat oil or ghee in a deep pan and fry the dough balls on low heat until they turn golden brown.
Drain the fried balls and soak them in warm sugar syrup for at least 30 minutes.
Serve Gulab Jamun warm or at room temperature.
